Plasma\\Client.name: Plasma\Client
Plasma\\Client.short_desc: The plasma client, responsible for pooling and connections.

__construct.name: __construct
__construct.short_desc: Creates a client with the specified factory and options.
__construct.long_desc:
Available options:
```
array(
    'connections.max' => int, (the maximum amount of connections to open, defaults to 5)
    'connections.lazy' => bool, (whether the first connection should be established lazily (on first request), defaults to false)
)
```
exceptions: The driver may throw this exception when invalid arguments (connect uri) were given, this may be thrown later when connecting lazy.

beginTransaction.name: beginTransaction
beginTransaction.short_desc: Begins a transaction. Resolves with a `Transaction` instance.
beginTransaction.long_desc:
Checks out a connection until the transaction gets committed or rolled back. If the transaction goes out of scope
and thus deallocated, the `Transaction` must check the connection back into the client.

Some databases, including MySQL, automatically issue an implicit COMMIT when a database definition language (DDL)
statement such as DROP TABLE or CREATE TABLE is issued within a transaction.
The implicit COMMIT will prevent you from rolling back any other changes within the transaction boundary.

checkinConnection.name: checkinConnection
checkinConnection.short_desc: Checks a connection back in, if usable and not closing.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes all connections gracefully after processing all outstanding requests.

create.name: create
create.short_desc: Creates a client with the specified factory and options.
exceptions: The client implementation may throw any exception during this operation.

execute.name: execute
execute.short_desc: Prepares and executes a query. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.
execute.long_desc:
This is equivalent to prepare -> execute -> close.
If you need to execute a query multiple times, prepare the query manually for performance reasons.

prepare.name: prepare
prepare.short_desc: Prepares a query. Resolves with a `StatementInterface` instance.

query.name: query
query.short_desc: Executes a plain query. Resolves with a `QueryResult` instance.

quit.name: quit
quit.short_desc: Forcefully closes the connection, without waiting for any outstanding requests. This will reject all oustanding requests.

quote.name: quote
quote.short_desc: Quotes the string for use in the query.
exceptions: Thrown if the driver does not support quoting.
Thrown if the client is closing all connections.

type.name: type
type.short_desc: For types, see the driver interface constants.

runCommand.name: runCommand
runCommand.hint_desc: Return depends on command and driver.
exceptions: Thrown if the client is closing all connections.

runQuery.name: runQuery
runQuery.short_desc: Runs the given querybuilder on an underlying driver instance.
runQuery.long_desc:
The driver CAN throw an exception if the given querybuilder is not supported.
An example would be a SQL querybuilder and a Cassandra driver.

Plasma\\ClientInterface.name: Plasma\ClientInterface
Plasma\\ClientInterface.short_desc: The client interface for plasma clients, responsible for creating drivers and pooling.
Plasma\\ClientInterface.long_desc:
It also provides a minimal public API for checking out a connection, get work done and checking the connection back in.

The client must support relaying forward events from the driver to the client. This is done with a driver event called `eventRelay`.
The listener callback for the driver is: `function (string $eventName, ...$args)`.
The client must always append the driver the event occurred on at the end of the `$args`. And emit the event, called `$eventName`, on itself.

Additionally to the event relaying, the client emits `close` and `error` events from the driver forward.
`close` event: The single argument is the `DriverInterface` (for debugging purpose).
`error` event: The first argument is a `\Throwable` and the second argument is the `DriverInterface` (for debugging purpose).

beginTransaction.name: beginTransaction
beginTransaction.short_desc: Begins a transaction. Resolves with a `TransactionInterface` instance.
beginTransaction.long_desc:
Checks out a connection until the transaction gets committed or rolled back.
It must be noted that the user is responsible for finishing the transaction. The client WILL NOT automatically
check the connection back into the pool, as long as the transaction is not finished.

Some databases, including MySQL, automatically issue an implicit COMMIT when a database definition language (DDL)
statement such as DROP TABLE or CREATE TABLE is issued within a transaction.
The implicit COMMIT will prevent you from rolling back any other changes within the transaction boundary.

checkinConnection.name: checkinConnection
checkinConnection.short_desc: Checks a connection back in, if usable and not closing.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes all connections gracefully after processing all outstanding requests.

create.name: create
create.short_desc: Creates a client with the specified factory and options.
exceptions: The client implementation may throw any exception during this operation.

uri.name: uri
uri.short_desc: The connect uri, which consists of `username:password@host:port`.

options.name: options
options.short_desc: Any options for the client, see client implementation for details.

quit.name: quit
quit.short_desc: Forcefully closes the connection, without waiting for any outstanding requests. This will reject all outstanding requests.

runCommand.name: runCommand
runCommand.hint_desc: Return depends on command and driver.
exceptions: Thrown if the client is closing all connections.

Plasma\\ColumnDefinition.name: Plasma\ColumnDefinition
Plasma\\ColumnDefinition.short_desc: Column Definitions define columns (who would've thought of that?). Such as their name, type, length, etc.

getDatabaseName.name: getDatabaseName
getDatabaseName.short_desc: Get the database name this column is in.

getDecimals.name: getDecimals
getDecimals.short_desc: Get the maximum shown decimal digits.

getLength.name: getLength
getLength.short_desc: Get the maximum field length, if any.

getTableName.name: getTableName
getTableName.short_desc: Get the table name this column is in.

getType.name: getType
getType.short_desc: Get the type name, such as `BIGINT`, `VARCHAR`, etc.

parseValue.name: parseValue
parseValue.short_desc: Parses the row value into the field type.

Plasma\\ColumnDefinitionInterface.name: Plasma\ColumnDefinitionInterface
Plasma\\ColumnDefinitionInterface.short_desc: This interface defines a common column definition abstraction.

getDatabaseName.name: getDatabaseName
getDatabaseName.short_desc: Get the database name this column is in.

getDecimals.name: getDecimals
getDecimals.short_desc: Get the maximum shown decimal digits.

getLength.name: getLength
getLength.short_desc: Get the maximum field length, if any.

getTableName.name: getTableName
getTableName.short_desc: Get the table name this column is in.

getType.name: getType
getType.short_desc: Get the type name, such as `BIGINT`, `VARCHAR`, etc.

isAutoIncrement.name: isAutoIncrement
isAutoIncrement.short_desc: Whether the column is auto incremented.

isMultipleKey.name: isMultipleKey
isMultipleKey.short_desc: Whether the column is part of a multiple/composite key.

isNullable.name: isNullable
isNullable.short_desc: Whether the column is nullable (not `NOT NULL`).

isPrimaryKey.name: isPrimaryKey
isPrimaryKey.short_desc: Whether the column is the primary key.

isUniqueKey.name: isUniqueKey
isUniqueKey.short_desc: Whether the column is the unique key.

isUnsigned.name: isUnsigned
isUnsigned.short_desc: Whether the column is unsigned (only makes sense for numeric types).

isZerofilled.name: isZerofilled
isZerofilled.short_desc: Whether the column gets zerofilled to the length.

parseValue.name: parseValue
parseValue.short_desc: Parses the row value into the field type.

Plasma\\CommandInterface.name: Plasma\CommandInterface
Plasma\\CommandInterface.short_desc: The basic interface for commands. Some drivers may extend this interface to provide additional functionalities.

getEncodedMessage.name: getEncodedMessage
getEncodedMessage.short_desc: Get the encoded message for writing to the database connection.

onComplete.name: onComplete
onComplete.short_desc: Sets the command as completed. This state gets reported back to the user.

onError.name: onError
onError.short_desc: Sets the command as errored. This state gets reported back to the user.

onNext.name: onNext
onNext.short_desc: Sends the next received value into the command.

waitForCompletion.name: waitForCompletion
waitForCompletion.short_desc: Whether this command sets the connection as busy.

Plasma\\DriverFactoryInterface.name: Plasma\DriverFactoryInterface
Plasma\\DriverFactoryInterface.short_desc: A driver factory is used to create new driver instances. The factory is responsible to create the drivers with the necessary arguments.

Plasma\\DriverInterface.name: Plasma\DriverInterface
Plasma\\DriverInterface.short_desc: The minimum public API a driver has to maintain. The driver MUST emit a `close` event when it gets disconnected from the server.

beginTransaction.name: beginTransaction
beginTransaction.short_desc: Begins a transaction. Resolves with a `TransactionInterface` instance.
beginTransaction.long_desc:
Checks out a connection until the transaction gets committed or rolled back.
It must be noted that the user is responsible for finishing the transaction. The client WILL NOT automatically
check the connection back into the pool, as long as the transaction is not finished.

Some databases, including MySQL, automatically issue an implicit COMMIT when a database definition language (DDL)
statement such as DROP TABLE or CREATE TABLE is issued within a transaction.
The implicit COMMIT will prevent you from rolling back any other changes within the transaction boundary.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes all connections gracefully after processing all outstanding requests.

endTransaction.name: endTransaction
endTransaction.short_desc: Informationally closes a transaction. This method is used by `Transaction` to inform the driver of the end of the transaction.

execute.name: execute
execute.short_desc: Prepares and executes a query. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.
execute.long_desc:
This is equivalent to prepare -> execute -> close.
If you need to execute a query multiple times, prepare the query manually for performance reasons.

getBacklogLength.name: getBacklogLength
getBacklogLength.short_desc: Get the length of the driver backlog queue.

isInTransaction.name: isInTransaction
isInTransaction.short_desc: Whether this driver is currently in a transaction.

pauseStreamConsumption.name: pauseStreamConsumption
pauseStreamConsumption.short_desc: Pauses the underlying stream I/O consumption.
pauseStreamConsumption.long_desc: If consumption is already paused, this will do nothing.

prepare.name: prepare
prepare.short_desc: Prepares a query. Resolves with a `StatementInterface` instance.
prepare.long_desc: When the command is done, the driver must check itself back into the client.

query.name: query
query.short_desc: Executes a plain query. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.
query.long_desc: When the command is done, the driver must check itself back into the client.

quit.name: quit
quit.short_desc: Forcefully closes the connection, without waiting for any outstanding requests. This will reject all outstanding requests.

quote.name: quote
quote.short_desc: Quotes the string for use in the query.
exceptions: Thrown if the driver does not support quoting.

resumeStreamConsumption.name: resumeStreamConsumption
resumeStreamConsumption.short_desc: Resumes the underlying stream I/O consumption.
resumeStreamConsumption.long_desc: If consumption is not paused, this will do nothing.

runCommand.name: runCommand
runCommand.long_desc: When the command is done, the driver must check itself back into the client.
runCommand.hint_desc: Return depends on command and driver.

runQuery.name: runQuery
runQuery.long_desc:
The driver CAN throw an exception if the given querybuilder is not supported.
An example would be a SQL querybuilder and a Cassandra driver.

STATE_IDLE.name: STATE_IDLE
STATE_IDLE.short_desc: Driver is idling and ready for requests.

CONNECTION_UNUSABLE.name: CONNECTION_UNUSABLE
CONNECTION_UNUSABLE.short_desc: The connection is closed and can not be reused.

CONNECTION_STARTED.name: CONNECTION_STARTED
CONNECTION_STARTED.short_desc: Waiting for connection to be made.

CONNECTION_AWAITING_RESPONSE.name: CONNECTION_AWAITING_RESPONSE
CONNECTION_AWAITING_RESPONSE.short_desc: Waiting for a response from the server.

CONNECTION_AUTH_OK.name: CONNECTION_AUTH_OK
CONNECTION_AUTH_OK.short_desc: Received authentication; waiting for backend startup.

CONNECTION_OK.name: CONNECTION_OK
CONNECTION_OK.short_desc: Connection is made and ready for use.

QUOTE_TYPE_IDENTIFIER.name: QUOTE_TYPE_IDENTIFIER
QUOTE_TYPE_IDENTIFIER.short_desc: Quoting should be applied on an identifier (such as table name, column name, etc.)

QUOTE_TYPE_VALUE.name: QUOTE_TYPE_VALUE
QUOTE_TYPE_VALUE.short_desc: Quoting should be applied on a value.

Plasma\\QueryResult.name: Plasma\QueryResult
Plasma\\QueryResult.short_desc: A class representing a regular query result (no SELECT), with no event emitter.

getAffectedRows.name: getAffectedRows
getAffectedRows.short_desc: Get the number of affected rows (for UPDATE, DELETE, etc.).

getFieldDefinitions.name: getFieldDefinitions
getFieldDefinitions.short_desc: Get the field definitions, if any. `SELECT` statements only.

getInsertID.name: getInsertID
getInsertID.short_desc: Get the used insert ID for the row, if any. `INSERT` statements only.

getRows.name: getRows
getRows.short_desc: Get the rows, if any. `SELECT` statements only.

getWarningsCount.name: getWarningsCount
getWarningsCount.short_desc: Get the number of warnings sent by the server.

Plasma\\QueryResultInterface.name: Plasma\QueryResultInterface
Plasma\\QueryResultInterface.short_desc: This is just a basic interface. There is an additional interface which defines that the query result is stream-based.
Plasma\\QueryResultInterface.long_desc: A driver might implement a query result based on ReactiveX instead, which will be documented as such.

getAffectedRows.short_desc: Get the number of affected rows (for UPDATE, DELETE, etc.).

getFieldDefinitions.name: getFieldDefinitions
getFieldDefinitions.short_desc: Get the field definitions, if any. `SELECT` statements only.

getInsertID.name: getInsertID
getInsertID.short_desc: Get the used insert ID for the row, if any. `INSERT` statements only.

getRows.name: getRows
getRows.short_desc: Get the rows, if any. `SELECT` statements only.

getWarningsCount.name: getWarningsCount
getWarningsCount.short_desc: Get the number of warnings sent by the server.

Plasma\\QueryableInterface.short_desc: Any queryable class (can execute queries) implements this indirectly or directly.

execute.name: execute
execute.short_desc: Prepares and executes a query. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.
execute.long_desc:
This is equivalent to prepare -> execute -> close.
If you need to execute a query multiple times, prepare the query manually for performance reasons.

prepare.name: prepare
prepare.short_desc: Prepares a query. Resolves with a `StatementInterface` instance.

query.name: query
query.short_desc: Executes a plain query. Resolves with a `QueryResultInterface` instance.

quote.name: quote

exceptions: Thrown if the driver does not support quoting.

type.short_desc: For types, see the driver interface constants.

runQuery.short_desc: Runs the given querybuilder on an underlying driver instance.
runQuery.long_desc:
The driver CAN throw an exception if the given querybuilder is not supported.
An example would be a SQL querybuilder and a Cassandra driver.

Plasma\\QuerybuilderInterface.name: Plasma\QuerybuilderInterface
Plasma\\QuerybuilderInterface.long_desc:
A querybuilder can be used to also provide drivers for NoSQL DBMS.
Through the querybuilder interface a driver can implement a querybuilder
to use through the generic Plasma client interface.

create.name: create
create.short_desc: Creates a new instance of the querybuilder.

getParameters.name: getParameters
getParameters.short_desc: Returns the associated parameters for the query.

getQuery.name: getQuery
getQuery.hint_desc: This may be a string for SQL.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes the prepared statement and frees the associated resources on the server.
close.long_desc: Closing a statement more than once SHOULD have no effect.

execute.name: execute
execute.short_desc: Executes the prepared statement. Resolves with a `QueryResult` instance.

getID.name: getID
getID.short_desc: Get the driver-dependent ID of this statement.
getID.long_desc: The return type can be of ANY type, as the ID depends on the driver and DBMS.

isClosed.name: isClosed
isClosed.short_desc: Whether the statement has been closed.

Plasma\\StreamQueryResult.name: Plasma\StreamQueryResult
Plasma\\StreamQueryResult.short_desc: A query result stream. Used to get rows row by row, as sent by the DBMS.

all.name: all
all.short_desc: Buffers all rows and returns a promise which resolves with an instance of `QueryResultInterface`.
all.long_desc:
This method does not guarantee that all rows get returned, as the buffering depends on when this
method gets invoked. There's no automatic buffering, as such rows may be missing if invoked too late.

close.name: close
close.short_desc: Closes the stream. Resumes the connection stream.

getAffectedRows.name: getAffectedRows
getAffectedRows.short_desc: Get the number of affected rows (for UPDATE, DELETE, etc.).

getFieldDefinitions.name: getFieldDefinitions
getFieldDefinitions.short_desc: Get the field definitions, if any. `SELECT` statements only.

getInsertID.name: getInsertID
getInsertID.short_desc: Get the used insert ID for the row, if any. `INSERT` statements only.

getRows.name: getRows
getRows.short_desc: Get the rows, if any. Returns always `null`.

getWarningsCount.name: getWarningsCount
getWarningsCount.short_desc: Get the number of warnings sent by the server.

pause.name: pause
pause.short_desc: Pauses the connection, where this stream is coming from.
pause.long_desc:
This operation halts ALL read activities. You may still receive
`data` events until the underlying network buffer is drained.

pipe.name: pipe
pipe.short_desc: Pipes all the data from this readable source into the given writable destination.
pipe.long_desc:
Automatically sends all incoming data to the destination.
Automatically throttles the source based on what the destination can handle.

resume.name: resume
resume.short_desc: Resumes the connection, where this stream is coming from.

Plasma\\StreamQueryResultInterface.name: Plasma\StreamQueryResultInterface
Plasma\\StreamQueryResultInterface.short_desc: This is the more advanced query result interface, which is a readable stream.
Plasma\\StreamQueryResultInterface.long_desc:
That means, for `SELECT` statements a `data` event will be emitted for each row.
At the end of a query, a `end` event will be emitted to notify of the completion.

all.name: all
all.short_desc: Buffers all rows and returns a promise which resolves with an instance of `QueryResultInterface`.
all.long_desc:
This method does not guarantee that all rows get returned, as the buffering depends on when this
method gets invoked. As such implementations may buffer rows directly from the start to ensure
all rows get returned. But users must not assume this behaviour is the case.

Plasma\\TransactionException.name: Plasma\TransactionException
Plasma\\TransactionException.short_desc: The exception for transaction exceptions, such as trying to use a finished transaction.

Plasma\\TransactionInterface.name: Plasma\TransactionInterface
Plasma\\TransactionInterface.short_desc: Transactions turn off auto-commit mode and let you rollback any changes you have done during it.
Plasma\\TransactionInterface.long_desc:
Some databases, including MySQL, automatically issue an implicit COMMIT when a database definition language (DDL)
statement such as DROP TABLE or CREATE TABLE is issued within a transaction.
The implicit COMMIT will prevent you from rolling back any other changes within the transaction boundary.

__destruct.name: __destruct
__destruct.short_desc: Destructor. Implicit rollback and automatically checks the connection back into the client on deallocation.

exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

createSavepoint.short_desc: Creates a savepoint with the given identifier.
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

getIsolationLevel.name: getIsolationLevel
getIsolationLevel.short_desc: Get the isolation level for this transaction.

isActive.name: isActive

releaseSavepoint.name: releaseSavepoint
releaseSavepoint.short_desc: Releases the savepoint with the given identifier.
exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

exceptions: Thrown if the transaction has been committed or rolled back.

ISOLATION_UNCOMMITTED.name: ISOLATION_UNCOMMITTED
ISOLATION_UNCOMMITTED.short_desc: Read Uncommitted is the lowest isolation level.
ISOLATION_UNCOMMITTED.long_desc:
In this level, one transaction may read not yet commited changes made by other transaction, thereby allowing dirty reads.
In this level, transactions are not isolated from each other.

ISOLATION_COMMITTED.name: ISOLATION_COMMITTED
ISOLATION_COMMITTED.short_desc: This isolation level guarantees that any data read is committed at the moment it is read.
ISOLATION_COMMITTED.long_desc:
Thus it does not allows dirty read.
The transaction hold a read or write lock on the current row, and thus prevent other rows from reading, updating or deleting it.

ISOLATION_REPEATABLE.name: ISOLATION_REPEATABLE
ISOLATION_REPEATABLE.short_desc: This is the most restrictive isolation level.
ISOLATION_REPEATABLE.long_desc:
The transaction holds read locks on all rows it references and write locks on all rows it inserts, updates, or deletes.
Since other transaction cannot read, update or delete these rows, consequently it avoids non repeatable read.

ISOLATION_SERIALIZABLE.name: ISOLATION_SERIALIZABLE
ISOLATION_SERIALIZABLE.short_desc: This is the highest isolation level.
ISOLATION_SERIALIZABLE.long_desc:
A serializable execution is guaranteed to be serializable. Serializable execution is defined to be an execution of operations
in which concurrently executing transactions appears to be serially executing.

canHandleType.name: canHandleType
canHandleType.short_desc: Whether the type extension can handle the conversion of the passed value.
canHandleType.long_desc:
Before this method is used, the common types are checked first.
`class` -> `interface` -> `type` -> this.

decode.name: decode
decode.short_desc: Decodes a binary database value into a PHP value.

value.name: value
value.short_desc: The encoded binary. Actual type depends on the driver.

encode.name: encode
encode.short_desc: Encodes a PHP value into a binary database value.

getDatabaseType.name: getDatabaseType
getDatabaseType.short_desc: Get the database type this Type Extension is for.

getHumanType.name: getHumanType
getHumanType.short_desc: Get the human-readable type this Type Extension is for.

Plasma\\Types\\TypeExtensionInterface.name: Plasma\Types\TypeExtensionInterface
Plasma\\Types\\TypeExtensionInterface.short_desc: A Type Extension is used to map database values (text/binary) to and from PHP values.
Plasma\\Types\\TypeExtensionInterface.long_desc:
A typical type extension is registered globally with the `TypeExtensionManager`.
The type conversion is always invoked by the driver and
yields from and to database types the equivalent conversions.

canHandleType.name: canHandleType
canHandleType.short_desc: Whether the type extension can handle the conversion of the passed value.
canHandleType.long_desc:
Before this method is used, the common types are checked first.
`class` -> `interface` -> `type` -> this.

decode.name: decode
decode.short_desc: Decodes a (binary) database value into a PHP value.

value.name: value
value.short_desc: The encoded (binary) database value. Actual type depends on the driver.

encode.name: encode
encode.short_desc: Encodes a PHP value into a (binary) database value.

getHumanType.name: getHumanType
getHumanType.short_desc: Get the human-readable type this Type Extension is for.

Plasma\\Types\\TypeExtensionResultInterf.name: Plasma\Types\TypeExtensionResultInterface
Plasma\\Types\\TypeExtensionResultInterf.short_desc: Represents a successful encoding conversion as general interface.

Plasma\\Types\\TypeExtensionsManager.name: Plasma\Types\TypeExtensionsManager
Plasma\\Types\\TypeExtensionsManager.short_desc: The Type Extension Manager manages type extensions globally.
Plasma\\Types\\TypeExtensionsManager.long_desc:
A case, where two different drivers are used in the same application,
is very rare. As such the normal use case is accessing statically (through the default manager).

Types should be automatically registered by the driver factory,
UNLESS the user opts-out of this behaviour.

For standard PHP types (such as `string`, `float`, etc.),
the type identifier is the type name (`float` is used instead of `double`).
For classes you can also use an interface name (e.g. `JsonSerializable`).

Anyone can register a specific manager under a name and access it statically.
One use case would be to create one specific manager per driver (type), if more than one is used.

decodeType.name: decodeType
exceptions: Thrown if unable to decode the value.

type.name: type
type.short_desc: The driver-dependent database type identifier. Can be `null` to not use the fast-path.

disableFuzzySearch.name: disableFuzzySearch
disableFuzzySearch.short_desc: Disables iterating over all types and invoking `canHandleType`, if quick type check is failing.

enableFuzzySearch.name: enableFuzzySearch
enableFuzzySearch.short_desc: Enables iterating over all types and invoking `canHandleType`, if quick type check is failing.

encodeType.name: encodeType
exceptions: Thrown if unable to encode the value.

getManager.name: getManager
getManager.short_desc: Get a specific Type Extensions Manager under a specific name.
exceptions: Thrown if the name does not exist.

name.name: name
name.short_desc: If `null` is passed, the generic global one will be returned.

registerDatabaseType.name: registerDatabaseType
exceptions: Thrown if the type identifier is already in use.

registerManager.name: registerManager
registerManager.short_desc: Registers a specific Type Extensions Manager under a specific name.
exceptions: Thrown if the name is already in use.

manager.name: manager
manager.short_desc: If `null` is passed, one will be created.

registerType.name: registerType
exceptions: Thrown if the type identifier is already in use.

unregisterDatabaseType.name: unregisterDatabaseType
unregisterDatabaseType.short_desc: Unregisters a Database type. A non-existent type identifier does nothing.

typeIdentifier.name: typeIdentifier
typeIdentifier.short_desc: The used type identifier. Depends on the driver.

unregisterManager.name: unregisterManager
unregisterManager.short_desc: Unregisters a name. If the name does not exist, this will do nothing.

unregisterType.name: unregisterType
unregisterType.short_desc: Unregisters a type. A non-existent type identifier does nothing.

GLOBAL_NAME.name: GLOBAL_NAME
GLOBAL_NAME.short_desc: The name for the global Type Extensions Manager.

parseParameters.name: parseParameters
parseParameters.short_desc: Parses a query containing parameters into an array, and can replace them with a predefined replacement (can be a callable).
parseParameters.long_desc: The callable is used to return numbered parameters (such as used in PostgreSQL), or any other kind of parameters supported by the DBMS.
parseParameters.hint_desc: `[ 'query' => string, 'parameters' => array ]`  The `parameters` array is an numeric array (= position, starting at 1), which map to the original parameter.

replaceParams.name: replaceParams
replaceParams.short_desc: If `null` is passed, it will not replace the parameters.

replaceParameters.name: replaceParameters
replaceParameters.short_desc: Replaces the user parameters keys with the correct parameters for the DBMS.
